meanings.definition: The ability to produce offspring or new growth.
meanings.sent1: The fecundities of the apple tree were evident in the abundance of ripe fruit hanging from its branches.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's success was due to the fecundities of his crops, yielding a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome joked that his fecundities were so impressive, he could grow a money tree.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of fecundities, where ideas bloomed and flourished.
meanings.sent5: The fecundities of the soil were so remarkable that even the barren land turned into a lush oasis.

meanings.definition: The state of being fertile or productive.
meanings.sent1: The fecundities of the hen were evident in the daily delivery of fresh eggs.
meanings.sent2: The artist's fecundities knew no bounds, as he created masterpiece after masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The factory manager proudly boasted about the fecundities of his production line, claiming it never missed a beat.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was a treasure trove of fecundities, sparking creativity in all who encountered her work.
meanings.sent5: The fecundities of the land were so remarkable that even the most barren fields became fertile and lush.
